title: Emilia Clarke shielded from the rain by at least four umbrellas
text:
We promise, Emilia Clarke IS in there somewhere… (Picture: Getty/Splash)

Emilia Clarke was in New York this week for the premiere of her new film, Last Christmas, and in true superstar style, she had a few assistants on hand to ensure she arrived looking flawless.

The actor, 33, went for a floor-length purple sequinned gown for the occasion, as well as sleek, straightened hair.

Now we all know straightened hair and drizzle don’t make for a good mix, so it’s just as well her team used not one but at least four umbrellas to make sure not a drop got on her or her outfit.

As well as ensuring she got to the premiere dry as a bone, it also served to be a pretty good shield against the waiting paparazzi too, as Emilia was barely visible under the sea of brollies.

Emilia was joined by Emma Thompson and Michelle Yeoh, who also star in Last Christmas, as they posed for photographers as they celebrated their new festive flick.

Last Christmas is due to be released next month, and sees Emilia’s character Kate, who has been consistently unlucky in love, meet a man called Tom (Henry Golding) after accepting a job as an elf in a department store over the festive period.

The movie was co-written by Emma, who also stars in the film, and she recently reveals she got the blessing of the late George Michael to write the screenplay based on Wham!’s hit song of the same name.

There she is! (Picture: Splash News)

During an appearance on The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon, Emma revealed: ‘This wonderful producer, David Livingstone, said, “Do you want to write a screenplay, a rom-com sort of thing, because we need a new Christmas movie based on Last Christmas”, and I said, “Not really, because it’s not my favourite Christmas song,”’

She added that once she had decided to get on board, she sent a ‘good treatment’ to George, and met up with him to discuss starting work on the project.

And it was all worthwhile to arrive looking this flawless (Picture: INSTAR Images)

Emma explained: ‘He was just the loveliest guy you could imagine. [He loved] all of these themes in the movie; he was passionate about homelessness, and he had this great social conscience.

‘I got really enthused and we started to write, and then – of course – he had that tragic early death in 2016, on Christmas Day. So we lost him, and I miss him so much.

‘I wish he was here because I know he’d love it, because the film’s like being hugged, and all of his music — we’ve got 15 of his songs, including a new one at the end — is so cool.

‘Heal the Pain, which is my favourite of his songs, it’s like it was written for the movie. He said that.’

Last Christmas will be released in the UK on 15 November.
